Night tunnel repairs forcing Storrow Drive detours

Drivers will face delays starting tonight as the westbound lanes close overnight for several months to fix a crumbling tunnel. (Boston Globe)

Heavy holiday traffic expected on the Pike

Officials said there will be enough staff at highway tolls, but warned that the sheer volume of people — especially on I-93 and 95 — will likely lead to delays. (Boston Globe)

Dead whale found in Boston Harbor

The more than 50-foot finback whale was seen floating early Sunday morning — a rarity for the area, the US Coast Guard said. The cause of death is unknown. (Globe)

President Obama’s tax
cuts go largely unnoticed

Obama is getting little credit for the cuts he pushed through Congress that were designed to put extra cash in everyday Americans’ pockets.
Opinion | Christopher L. Gasper

Patriots’ no-huddle attack impressive

New England racked up a franchise-record 35 first downs against a Broncos team that was struggling to make substitutions or even line up properly.

Charging stations may solve a big problem: unmanned devices’ short-lived batteries.

Move over, generals and diplomats. The lawyers are looking for a little action, and the next “war” may very well be in litigation.

Cambridge’s Labtiva wants to apply the iTunes sales approach to often costly research.

How family lore shapes character

Those who slur Senate candidate Elizabeth Warren’s “character” miss how the trove of family story, myth, and memory shapes a person.
G Cover

Hospitals try to halt rise in C-sections

As the number of cesarean sections has risen sharply, experts say that childbirth has become overly medicalized and overly expensive.
